image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives

profileText: a Representative from Oklahoma; born in Winslow, Navajo County, Ariz., March 11, 1967; an enrolled member of the Cherokee Nation; graduated from Jenks High School, Jenks, Okla., 1985; B.A., Baylor University, Waco, Tex., 1989; Rhodes Scholar, M.A., Oxford University, Oxford, England, 1991; J.D., University of Oklahoma, Norman, Okla., 1994.; lawyer, private practice; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Seventh and to the succeeding Congress (January 3, 2001-January 3, 2005); was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Ninth Congress in 2004, but was an unsuccessful candidate for election to the United States Senate; business executive; United States Navy, 2008-2009; faculty, University of Tulsa, Okla., 2009-2012; General Counsel of the Army, United States Army, 2011-2014; Under Secretary of the Army, United States Army, 2014-2016; Acting Under Secretary of Defense for Personnel and Readiness, United States Department of Defense, 2015-2016; faculty, University of Virginia, Charlottesville, Va., 2018-2021; president, University of Tulsa, Tulsa, Okla., 2021-present.
